text: Lucia Quinciani (c. 1566, fl. 1611) was an Italian composer. She is the earliest known published female composer of monody.Thomas W. Bridges. "Lucia Quinciani", Grove Music Online, ed. L. Macy (accessed November 5, 2006), grovemusic.com (subscription access). She is known only by one composition, a setting of "Udite lagrimosi spirti d’Averno, udite", from Giovanni Battista Guarini's Il pastor fido, found in Marcantonio Negri's Affetti amorosi second volume (1611),Gary Tomlison (ed). Italian secular song, 1606-1636 : a seven- volume reprint collection. Vol. 5 in which Negri refers to Quinciani as his student.
